medical_history.chief_complaint: A 71-year-old man presented with a 1-month history of cough and progressive fatigue, along with transient bilateral vision loss triggered by coughing.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported bilateral vision loss lasting 5 to 10 seconds during bouts of coughing for a month, with worsening symptoms leading to an episode of complete bilateral vision loss lasting 5 minutes, provoked by straining while voiding.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was previously healthy, fit, a non-smoker, and had well-managed blood pressure. He had no alcohol abuse or significant family history.
